intro: Physedra ivorensis, commonly known as the Ivory Coast physedra, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants like philodendrons and caladiums. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences consisting of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
